definition: perspiration/sweat/CL:滴[di1],頭|头[tou2],身[shen1]/to be speechless (out of helplessness, embarrassment etc) (Internet slang used as an interjection)
see 可汗[ke4 han2], 汗國|汗国[han2 guo2]

sentences.english: Playing computer games all day lavishes parents' hard-earned money.
sentences.chinese: 整天玩电脑游戏浪费父母的血汗钱。

sentences.english: It was built with the blood and sweat of the labouring people.
sentences.chinese: 这是用劳动人民的血汗建成的。

sentences.english: Forget about throwing billions more of taxpayer money at Motown.
sentences.chinese: 别再打算拿几十亿纳税人血汗钱往汽车城打水漂了。

sentences.english: If you are smart, you will spend your hard-earned money (or your parents') somewhere else.
sentences.chinese: 如果你是聪明的，你会花你的血汗钱在其他地方。

sentences.english: In its report, Apple revealed the sweatshop conditions inside the factories it uses.
sentences.chinese: 在报告中，苹果反映了它使用的血汗工厂的情况。

sentences.english: There laws are very stringent and anybody swindles public money will be executed.
sentences.chinese: 法律应该严惩那些企图骗取人民血汗钱的恶人。

sentences.english: So which deserves your hard-earned cash?
sentences.chinese: 那么，谁更对得起你的血汗钱呢？

sentences.english: Playing computer games squanders parents' hard-earned cash.
sentences.chinese: 打游戏机浪费父母的血汗钱。

sentences.english: The American People need to know who is costing them their hard earned money.
sentences.chinese: 美国人民需要知道是谁把他们的血汗钱给糟蹋了。

sentences.english: It is, as politicians like to say, about our blood and treasure.
sentences.chinese: 就如政客们常说的，这关乎到我们的血汗和财富。

sentences.english: The capitalists batten on the blood of the workers.
sentences.chinese: 资本家靠榨取工人的血汗来养肥自己。

sentences.english: But I dont know whether I can get back my hard-earned money or not.
sentences.chinese: 但我不知道我能否找回我的血汗钱与否。

sentences.english: This White House, which is now his house, was built with the labor of black slaves.
sentences.chinese: 白宫，现在已是他的官邸，却曾是用黑奴的血汗筑成。

sentences.english: Perhaps that is why Dunga preaches such sweat and toil.
sentences.chinese: 也许这也是邓加大力强调血汗价值的原因。

sentences.english: Fooling around with hard-earned savings is asking for trouble.
sentences.chinese: 有了点血汗钱就游手好闲，那是自寻烦恼。

sentences.english: The usurers are leeches; they have drained us dry.
sentences.chinese: 高利贷者是吸血鬼，他们吸干了我们的血汗。

definition: tears of blood (symbol of extreme suffering)/blood and tears
with callouses on hands and feet (idiom)/to work one's fingers to the bone
to follow orders/to abide by/to obey
lit. to spit out one's heart and spill blood (idiom)/to work one's heart out/blood, sweat and tears
lit. the fat and wealth of the people (idiom); the nation's hard-won wealth (esp. as an object of unscrupulous exploitation)/the people's blood, sweat and tears
to throw one's life in for/to haplessly give one's life for/to sacrifice oneself torturously working for another or for a group/to pour in one's utmost effort/to shed one's last ounce of strength for
